Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery dinos or krater; interior glazed black (fired red); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bridled horse (part of muzzle with bridle and rein, chest and part of forelegs remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 139, no. 6)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 87, pl.X, no. 4.) (no. 3 in text.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.060) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
